alert.note: Alert for Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 25 at 4:13PM MDT until June 25 at 5:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE CERRO PELADO BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR EAST CENTRAL SANDOVAL COUNTY... At 413 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated showers and thunderstorms producing light to moderate rain over the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. Between 0.25 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact Canada Camada and Rio Chiquito. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of East Central Sandoval County FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the Cerro Pedlado fire burn area. Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
